definition: to serve as a stopgap/to make up a shortfall in the number of people
to gather together, pool or collect/to happen by chance/to move close to/to exploit an opportunity
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: He would order 300 musicians at a time to play the Yu for him.
sentences.chinese: 有一個南郭先生，本來不會吹竽，也混在中間湊數。

sentences.english: If any guest failed at the eleventh hour, Todd was asked to dine.
sentences.chinese: 要是有什麼客人到時不能來，託德就給請來湊數。

sentences.english: We don't want to bring anyone in just for the sake of bringing.
sentences.chinese: 我們不會爲了湊數而隨意購買球員。

sentences.english: Food manufacturers are required to list ingredients in order of quantity after all.
sentences.chinese: 食品生產商按要求列出成分表畢竟只爲了湊數。

sentences.english: I'd rather have 24 players, but I don't want to take players on just to make up the numbers.
sentences.chinese: 我更傾向於擁有24名選手，但是我不會單純的湊數。
